metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21702 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.27, 7.4.x below 7.4.15 and 8.0.x below 8.0.2, when using SOAP extension to connect to a SOAP server, a malicious SOAP server could return malformed XML data as a response that would cause PHP to access a null pointer and thus cause a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.0-1
php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cli - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-common - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-curl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-dba - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-enchant - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gd - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-imap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-interbase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-intl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-ldap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pspell - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-readline - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-snmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-soap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xml - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xsl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-zip - 8.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0-1').
